markings: possible maker's mark stitched into top right tab
text: Battlefield curtains, or jinmaku, were used by feudal lords as temporary structures for meetings. They provide a private space, keep out prying eyes and at the same time give protection from wind. At some point in time, these curtains were decorated with the crest of the owner, in this case two different crests used by the Hosokawa family.
title: Purple camp curtain with white crests of the Hosokawa family
